meanings.sent1: The small child sought the egis of his parents when he felt scared.
meanings.sent2: The egis of the law ensures that everyone is treated fairly.
meanings.sent3: The egis of the umbrella kept the raindrops away from the girl's head.
meanings.sent4: The egis of friendship shielded her from loneliness.
meanings.sent5: Under the egis of the teacher, the students felt safe to ask questions.

meanings.sent1: The knight's egis protected him from enemy arrows during battle.
meanings.sent2: She polished her egis before heading into the arena for the fight.
meanings.sent3: The shiny egis reflected the sunlight, blinding the opponent momentarily.
meanings.sent4: His egis was adorned with intricate designs, showcasing his noble status.
meanings.sent5: The warrior's egis bore the emblem of his kingdom, instilling fear in his foes.

meanings.definition: Aegis or shield of Zeus in Greek mythology
meanings.sent1: In the ancient tales, Zeus wielded the powerful egis to protect his allies.
meanings.sent2: The egis of Zeus was said to have the ability to repel any attack.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous god Hermes once borrowed the egis to play a prank on the other gods.
meanings.sent4: The egis of Zeus was as mighty as the thunderbolts he hurled.
meanings.sent5: Under the egis of Zeus, the mortals felt a sense of divine protection.
